QREC.FB:

This idea is mentioned in the fourth paragraph.

As you see in this paragraph:

Inxhinier – aplikanti duhet të ketë diplomë të inxhinierit në fushën mekanike. Aplikanti duhet të ketë të paktën tre vjet eksperiencë në këtë fushë. Aplikanti duhet të punojë me turne paradite ose mbasdite.  (Engineer – The applicant must have a degree in mechanical engineering. He must have at least three years experience in this field. The applicant must work morning or afternoon shifts.)

Note the following points while you are reading this segment of the text:

  • Note the semi-auxiliary duhet, which expresses the modal meaning of necessity and in our case duhet të punojë (must work). Note that this word, depending on the context translates as must; should; is needed.
  • turne (shifts) - n., acc. case, pl., indef. Note the preposition me (with) which takes accusative case objects. Common noun objects of accusative case prepositions often appear in an indefinite form in Albanian.
  • Note how the words paradite (morning) and mbasdite (aftenoon) are formed:

      paradite: para (before) + dite (day). This is the time from early morning until noon. This is similar to morning in English. However, Albanians also say mëngjes to refer to morning, or the morning meal (breakfast).

      mbasdite: mbas (after) + dite (day). This is the time from noon until the evening.

QREC.POP_UP:
Cognates

Cognates are words of different languages with similar language roots. In general, when reading Albanian articles you may notice a lot of cognates with English language roots. Pay attention to them, as their presence will help you understand words that you did not know before in Albanian. By understanding cognates, you will better guess various passages.

With globalization, and the new technology, more and more words are borrowed from the English language and are being "Albanialized." For example: globale (global); interneti (the internet), etc.

The article you already read and the one you are about to read in this activity contain a number of cognates. Here is an example from the very last paragraph of the article:

Adresa e qendrës: Autostrada Tiranë – Durrës, kilometri i gjashtë. Telefon: 3553801; Faks: 3553811. Burimet Njerëzore: Suela Muja.

Can you guess the cognates?

Ok, here they are: Adresa (address); kilometri (kilometer); Telefon (telephone, phone); Faks (fax)

You can find these requirements in this segment of the text:

  • aplikanti duhet të ketë patentë (the applicant must have a driver's license)
  • Ai duhet të jetë në gjendje të transportojë gjërat nga Tirana në rrethe edhe nga rrethet në Tiranë (He must be able to transport goods from Tirana to other areas or from other areas to Tirana).
  • The semi-auxiliary duhet, which expresses the modal meaning of necessity or compulsion, is used chiefly in the present and imperfect, and usually only in an invariable third person singular form, no matter what the person and number of the subject is. For example: Unë duhet të punoj (I must work) - Depending on the context, duhet is translated as should, must, need to.
  • shofer kamioni - truck driver
  • patentë - driver's license. Note that in Albanian you don't need to mention the word shofer (driver) for this. For example: Ke patentë? (Do you have a driver's license?)
  • Ai (he) it is a pronoun referring to the truck driver.
  • gjërat - note that here it means goods. However, this word often refers to things. For example: ka shumë gjëra mbi tavolinë (there are many things on the table). In general, Albanians often say mallra to refer to goods.

Note the cognates in this sentence: aplikanti (the applicant); transportojë ( to transport)
QREC.STIMULUS: What are two requirements for a cleaning person applicant?
QREC.RIGHT_FB:
Pay attention to the following in the second paragraph:

  • Pastrues
  • në turnin e natës
  • testin e sigurisë
QREC.WRONG_FB:
1. A janitor must be ready to work only night shifts.

2. No experience is necessary.

3. Applicants must pass the security test.

As you can find in this segment of the text:

Pastrues – shtatë punëtorë kërkohen. Aplikantët duhet të punojnë vetëm në turnin e natës. Nuk duhet eksperiencë. Aplikantët duhet vetëm të kalojnë testin e sigurisë. (Cleaning persons—seven workers are needed. The applicants must be ready to work only night shifts. No experience is necessary. The applicants must pass a security test. )

The word pastrues (cleaning person) derives from the verb pastroj (to clean).

në turnin e natës - in the night shift

turnin - n., sing., def., acc. case

natës - n., sing., def., gen. case.

testin e sigurisë - the security test. Note that when speaking about tests in school, Albanians say provim.

Note the cognates: aplikantët; experiencë; testin (applicants; experience; test.)
QREC.STIMULUS: What is one benefit offered with the salary?
QREC.RIGHT_FB:
Pay attention to the following in the third paragraph:

  • do të paguhen edhe për transportin
QREC.WRONG_FB:
One benefit provided is the transportation.

As you see in the paragraph before the address:

Punëtorët do të paguhen me rrogë çdo dy javë, po ashtu do të paguhen edhe për transportin. (The workers will be paid salary every two weeks; they will be paid for transportation as well.)

The noun punëtorët (workers) is the plural form of the noun punëtor (worker). This noun derives from the verb punoj (to work).

po ashtu - as well

Note that in addition to the word rrogë (salary), Albanians also use pagë (salary; pay) whose root comes from the verb paguaj (to pay).

The future form of the verb pagoj (to pay) is used in this sentence, since this is about a promise that the company makes to the applicants if they get the job. Note that the future form is formed by adding do in front of the main verb, which is in subjunctive: do të paguhen (they will be paid.)

Note that transportin is a cognate of the English word transport.
